definition: to lean/to slant/oblique/prejudiced/to deviate from average/to stray from the intended line/stubbornly/contrary to expectations

sentences.english: Extreme formant shifting is like 1/2 speed tape , but realtime.
sentences.chinese: 偏激的共振峰偏移像半速运行的磁带，但是实时的。

sentences.english: Moral exuberance had inspired both overinvolvement and isolationism.
sentences.chinese: 精神上偏激引起了过多承担义务和孤立主义。

sentences.english: Ad hominem attacks are a signal of defeat in a debate.
sentences.chinese: 偏激的抨击是则是争辩中失败的象征。

sentences.english: The more conservative politicians were trying to deradicalize the liberation movement.
sentences.chinese: 较保守的政治家正试图使解放运动放弃偏激的立场。

sentences.english: As always, if we over-compensated, we'll adjust the numbers again. But as I said, our initial round of nerfs wasn't sufficient.
sentences.chinese: 经常，假若我们偏激了，我们会再一次更动这些数字。

sentences.english: I find the whole slant of this article pejorative and misleading.
sentences.chinese: 我发现，文章的落脚点是偏激的且具有误导性的。

sentences.english: Issues quickly get polarized, and then further polarized by the media, which needs extreme viewpoints to draw attention and increase audience size.
sentences.chinese: 媒体需要偏激的观点以吸引人们的眼球，扩大受众群。

sentences.english: In my view, the students are too extreme.
sentences.chinese: 在我看来，这些学生太偏激了。

sentences.english: In turn debates and discussions of these developments often allocate time and energy to the extremes.
sentences.chinese: 依次偏激地辩论和讨论这些发展经常分配时间和精力。
至少可以说这种言论太偏激了。

sentences.english: However your position is very polarized, there is a great deal of detail in the implemenation.
sentences.chinese: 你可能是对的，不过太偏激，有很多细节值得商榷。

sentences.english: The extremer Puritan mood had gone.
sentences.chinese: 过于偏激的清教徒精神既已消逝。

sentences.english: She tends to go to extremes.
Doing something drastic like this can completely change your whole outlook on life.
sentences.chinese: 做些可以彻底改变你对生命的看法的近乎偏激的事情。

sentences.english: One expert said personality disorders may be overdiagnosed.
sentences.chinese: 有专家称对性格紊乱的诊断也许偏激。

sentences.english: His political ideas are too extreme for me.
sentences.chinese: 我认为他的政治观点太偏激了。

definition: unkind/harsh/cutting/mean/acrimony/to embezzle by making illegal deductions
to act impetuously (idiom); on an impulse
to rebel against orthodoxy/to depart from established practices
